name: Masala Chai
history: Masala Chai, a flavored tea beverage, has its origins in India. The traditional Indian brew is made by boiling black tea with a mixture of aromatic spices and herbs. Over the years, it has gained popularity worldwide.
description: Masala Chai is a spiced tea renowned for its fragrant and comforting qualities. It typically consists of black tea simmered with a blend of spices such as cardamom, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and black pepper, combined with milk and sweetened to taste.

instructions.title: Boil Spices and Water
instructions.description: In a saucepan, combine water, cardamom, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and black peppercorns. Bring to a boil.

instructions.title: Add Tea Leaves
instructions.description: Add the black tea leaves to the boiling water. Boil for another minute.

instructions.title: Add Milk and Sugar
instructions.description: Reduce the heat and add the milk and sugar. Simmer for 2-3 minutes.

instructions.title: Strain and Serve
instructions.description: Strain the chai into a cup. Serve hot.

tips: Adjust the amount of spices and sugar according to personal preference.
Simmering the tea on low heat helps to enhance the flavors of the spices.
variations: Try different types of milk like almond or soy for a vegan version.
Experiment with adding other spices like nutmeg or star anise.

storage.instructions: Not recommended for storage, as the flavor is best when fresh.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stovetop until hot, but do not boil.
presentationTips: Serve in traditional clay cups for an authentic experience.
Garnish with a sprinkle of ground cinnamon or a cinnamon stick.
